notes: Marginal phoneme typically realized as the schwa /ə/, but also capable of standing in for any vowel not found in Xextan. On its own it may be used to denote a filler word ("uh", "um", "er") or a nonverbal utterance (cry, scream, yelp, bark, etc.) while in particle-shaped syllables (e.g. «py», «ty») it creates a free modifier representing a generic onomatopoeia
older texts may use «bu», as this word was reassigned late into the development of pre-alpha Xextan
